overview.base: Having mastered the basic techniques in this field of magic, you are able to cast more advanced spells. If you create any Elder Sorcery spells of your own, they get added to this list. However, just because you "know" how to cast these spells, doesn't mean you are always prepared to. Although all mage classes grant their own elder sorcery and rotator spells, you may only have a maximum of 2 × (MR - 1) of these spells rotated into your spell list at any given time across all classes. MR refers to the number of ranks you have in mage classes. During a long rest, you can "rotate" which spells you have prepared. The rotator spells automatically available to you are Crown of Ice, Dispel Magic, Displace, Resist Effects, and Spell Trigger.
overview.proficient: You may instead prepare P of these spells.
overview.fluent: You may instead prepare F of these spells.

overview.base: A small circle of glowing frost circles above your head. You gain Shock Touch and Blizzard Aura.

results.hit: Target is frozen.
results.critHit: The target automatically fails the first [[/roll 2d4]] roll.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, deal an additional [[/damage 1d4[magic ice]]] damage as well.
system.endCondition: At the end of each of the target's actions, they roll [[/roll 2d4]]. If either of these dice roll a 4, this effect ends.

results.fail: Target is frozen.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, deal an additional [[/damage 1d4[magic ice]]] damage as well.
system.endCondition: At the start of each of the target's actions, they roll [[/roll 2d4]]. If either of these dice roll a 4, this effect ends.

overview.base: Target spell fizzles.
overview.proficient: You may now use Dispel Magic P additional times as a free reaction before the start of your next turn. These additional uses do not in turn allow for additional uses.
overview.fluent: You may now use Dispel Magic F additional times as a free reaction before the start of your next turn. These additional uses do not in turn allow for additional uses.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, the range of Dispel Magic increases by 10 feet.
system.endCondition: The start of your next turn.
system.requirements: Target is a conjured spell.
system.trigger: A conjured spell is used within range.

overview.base: You are instantly transported to a location you can see within range.
overview.proficient: The range becomes 10 × P feet.
overview.fluent: The range becomes 10 × F feet.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, the range increases by 10 feet.
system.trigger: You cast a missile or weapon delivery spell.

overview.base:
Pick one of the following effect types. You resist effects of that type.
  1. Awakening effects
  2. Control effects
  3. Displacement effects
  4. Duel modifying effects
  5. Financial effects
  6. Healing effects
  7. Killing effects
  8. Knockout effects
  9. Loud effects
  10. Mental effects
  11. Poison effects
  12. Reanimation effects
  13. Regeneration effects
  14. Revitalization effects
  15. Revival effects
  16. Stealing effects
  17. Summoning effects
  18. Temporal effects
  19. Transformation effects
  20. Truth detecting effects
You cast one single action spell you have that is not delivered by an item.
